Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> fully decentralized cross chain atomic swaps appear to be the only type of "exchange" that fits into the exemptions defined by the recent SEC fincen guidelines. there is actually a specific paragraph stating it is exempt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Looks like Komodo and Verus are ahead of all exchanges in that respect...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> yes, a lot of fake DEX, claiming to be decentralized, but most of those are using a proxy token and then trading onchain the token. so being a DEX for a token, but the real coins are controlled by a single entity. i only know of a few multisig gateways, which might be enough to overcome the custodial burden. but the entire proxy token DEX, it just seems like not enough to fit into the exemption

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> turns out the decentralization in this case is not just for idealistic reasons

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> fully decentralized cross chain atomic DEX seems the only way to avoid the regulations, likely as the regulators realized it couldnt be regulated anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> I was just about to say that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> however, they did even give an exemption to informational sites that displayed status of the atomic DEX, which is something they didnt have to do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> they did also say that a dapp that is doing money transmission is subject to regulation, though not sure how they will regulate code on the blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> a Dapp is (IMO) a point of entry to the blockchain... Nothing centralized about that.... On the other hand, I can imaging them reasoning a dapp being centrally created / updated / maintained. That would throw us back in the discussion similar to whether the swiping wallets on KMD chain was a centralized action...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> they seem to model things based on ETH smart contracts that need to be refilled with ETH for gas
